description.text:
ASU’s Tempe campus is where it all started. The Tempe campus offers over 300 majors in an energetic environment – comprised of eclectic architecture, iconic landmarks and rich tradition. Students from all backgrounds, cultures and walks of life come to ASU and call it home. Bring your family, explore the campus and find out why! ASU Open Door 2018 @ Tempe is a rare opportunity to a get behind the scenes look into the spaces that house the most innovative projects, including the Biodesign Institute, ASU Super Computer, Mars Space Flight Facility, Marston Exploratory Theater, and more.
Tickets to ASU Open Door 2018 are free. All guests are requested to have a ticket.
SPECIAL OFFER*: Order your tickets by Wednesday, February 22 to enter into the drawing for the "ASU Open Door 2018 - Tempe" gift bag.
*Terms and conditions apply. See opendoor.asu.edu website for details.

description.text:
Friday 6:00-9:00 PM Empowered You Leadership Training (For Elites and higher. Free)
Discover your authentic leadership by identifying your own unique strengths and how using them can help you become a more influential and effective leader. 
Saturday 9:00-11:30 AM The doTERRA Difference (Free)
At dōTERRA, we are on a mission to empower individuals. Education is key to helping people make better decisions toward improving their wellbeing. After learning what makes doTERRA different product demonstration booths will be set up.
Saturday 1:00-3:30 AM Empowered Success Business Training ($10)
Our business experts will teach you how doTERRA can help you prosper financially through our unique business model. 
 For Full Details See Below 
Consulte la seccion de abajo para ver informacion en Espanol. 
Friday Evening: 6:00 - 9:00 PM Empowered You Leadership Training (For Elites and higher. This is a free training.)
Qualify to attend this Leadership Training by hitting the rank of Elite or above within 3 months of this event.
dōTERRA recognizes that many of our members have a desire to make a huge impact and influence more lives as they share and build with dōTERRA. With that in mind, our “Empowered You” leadership training is designed to help you discover your authentic leadership by identifying your own unique strengths and how using them can help you become a more influential and effective leader. In this training you will learn how to:

Identify and more effectively lead with your own unique strengths and talents 
Develop positive and consist behaviors that will be crucial to your success
Connect and communicate more effectively within your sphere of influence
Match your strengths with your passion to gain a clear vision of your path as a leader
Empower and inspire others to realize their own potential


Saturday Morning: 9:00-11:30 AM The doTERRA Difference (Free to everyone)
Today more and more people are looking for natural solutions to enjoy a healthier lifestyle. At dōTERRA, we are on a mission to empower individuals, families and communities to improve their health and wellness. We believe that education is key to helping people make better decisions toward improving their wellbeing. Now is the time to learn how dōTERRAs product can help you live a healthier and more vibrant life. Please join our Health and Wellness experts to learn:

Why doTERRA is different from other essential oil companies
What makes doTERRA Essential Oils the most potent and effective
How you join us in our mission to make the world a better place
How you can support your Family’s Health using doTERRA’s essential oils and nutritional supplements. 
Following the “doTERRA Difference” presentation, there will be multiple product demonstration booths set up throughout the room where Wellness Advocates and their guests can see how the products work, sample and ask questions.  


Saturday Afternoon: 1:00 – 3:30 PM Empowered Success Business Training ($10 Registration fee per person)
Our business experts will teach you how doTERRA can help you prosper financially through our unique business model. We will teach on the following topics during this session:

Learn how your mindset could potentially be holding you back from wellness and financial prosperity
Discover how to share doTERRA with your friends and family in a way that feels natural
Explore how you can pay for your own products, earn extra income or how to create a career income all by using and sharing doTERRA essential oils
Learn about the tools that will support your efforts in sharing doTERRA and educating people about essential oils


If you need ASL interpretation for this event please email events@doterra.com at least 2 weeks prior to the event so we can arrange an interpreter.


Viernes por la noche: 6:00 - 9:00 PM Capacitación de liderazgo “Tú empoderado” (Gratis para todos)
Califica para asistir a esta capacitación de liderazgo logrando el rango de Élite o superior dentro de tres meses antes de este evento. dōTERRA reconoce que muchos de nuestros miembros tienen el deseo de causar un gran impacto e influir más vidas al compartir y construir sus negocios dōTERRA. Teniendo eso en mente, nuestra capacitación de liderazgo “Tú empoderado” fue diseñada para ayudarte a descubrir tu liderazgo auténtico identificando tus propias fortalezas personales y la manera en que usarlas puede ayudarte a convertirte en un líder más influyente y eficaz. En esta capacitación aprenderás a:
 • Identificar tus propias fortalezas y talentos, y dirigir con mayor eficacia mediante su uso
 • Desarrollar conductas positivas y constantes que serán cruciales para tu éxito
 • Conectarte y comunicarte más eficazmente dentro de tu esfera de influencia
 • Emparejar tus fortalezas con tu pasión para desarrollar una visión clara de tu ruta de líder
 • Empoderar e inspirar a otros para que alcancen su propio potencial
 
 
Sábado por la mañana: 9:00 - 11:30 AM Lo que distingue a dōTERRA (Gratis para todos)
En la actualidad más y más personas andan en busca de soluciones naturales para disfrutar de condiciones de vida más saludables. En dōTERRA tenemos la misión de empoderar a individuos, familias y comunidades para que mejoren su salud y bienestar. Creemos que la educación es clave para ayudar a la gente a tomar mejores decisiones para aumentar su bienestar. Ahora es el momento de aprender la manera en que los productos dōTERRA pueden ayudarte a vivir una vida más saludable y vibrante. Participa con nuestros expertos en salud y bienestar y aprenderás:
 • Por qué dōTERRA es diferente de otras empresa de aceites esenciales • Qué hace que los aceites esenciales dōTERRA sean los más potentes y eficaces
 • Cómo puedes unirte a nosotros en nuestra misión de mejorar el mundo
 • Cómo puedes apoyar la salud de tu familia usando aceites esenciales y suplementos nutritivos dōTERRA
 • Después de la presentación “Lo que distingue a dōTERRA” tendremos múltiples quioscos de demostración de productos por todo el salón; ahí los Distribuidores Independientes y sus invitados podrán ver la manera en que funcionan los productos, probarlos y hacer preguntas.
 

Sábado por la tarde: 1:00 - 3:30 PM Capacitación de negocios “Éxito empoderado” (cuota de inscripción de $10 por persona)
Nuestros expertos en negocios te enseñarán la manera en que dōTERRA puede ayudarte a prosperar financieramente a través de nuestro singular modelo de negocios. En esta sesión enseñaremos sobre los siguientes temas:
 • Aprende la manera en que tu actitud mental podría estarte impidiendo lograr el bienestar y la prosperidad financiera
 • Descubre la manera de compartir dōTERRA con tus amigos y parientes de modo tal que se sienta como algo natural
 • Explora la manera en que puedes pagar tus propios productos, ganar ingresos adicionales o crear un ingreso profesional mediante el uso y compartimiento de los aceites esenciales dōTERRA
• Conoce herramientas que apoyarán tus esfuerzos de compartir dōTERRA y educar a otros en cuanto a los aceites esenciales

Whether it is for fashion, beauty, lifestyle or health, the Women's Day Out Expo will bring together these resources in one place. The Women's Day Out Expo offers women an event to attend, celebrate, splurge, and embrace Womanhood.The expo will feature exhibits featuring products and services:

description.text:
The original creators of the waterpark music festival are returning to Arizona to kick off Summer with the largest event of the year! On April 28th, Wet Electric takes over Big Surf Waterpark in Tempe, Arizona and will produce the largest pool party in the country. Experience the thrills of a waterpark along with the sights and sounds of an electronic music festival. Wet Electric features world renowned artists and DJ’s, the largest wavepool in the country, waterslides, luxury cabanas, bars and much more. Wet Electric is a truly unique experience as it combines music, waterslides and an unbelievable vibe. 
Artist announcements for 2018 coming soon!
Previous artists include Tiesto, Diplo, Dillon Francis, Dada Life, Eric Prydz, Destructo, Justin Jay, Dash Berlin, and many others!
This event is 18+ to enter and 21+ to drink.

name.text: 2018 ADOT DBE & Small Business Transportation Expo
name.html: 2018 ADOT DBE & Small Business Transportation Expo

description.text:
This half-day Expo format is the chance to mix and mingle with 500+ transportation business professionals. Hear about upcoming capital projects, network with prime Consultants and Contractors who design and build these projects. Network with not only ADOT, but the City of Phoenix Streets Transportation and Transit Departments, Valley Metro, and Sky Harbor International Airport.
Registration costs have been waived due to the generous sponsorship by Connect 202 Partners. This event is free to attend. Sponsorships and exhibit tables are available.

description.text:
About The Course
Reserve your spot today to receive instant access to valuable wealth management and financial growth techniques that will introduce you to the Millionaire Mind method developed by T. Harv Eker.
Millionaire Mind Audio CourseAUDIO 1: Ft. Bill BartmannAUDIO 2: Ft. Alex Mandossian
Your wealth and income is a direct result of how you think and feel about money. It's time to program your mindset for increased income and greater wealth!
The Millionaire Mind Intensive is a 3-day, in-person, course designed to teach you the tools to improve your money management, create financial opportunity and overcome ANY challenges that are keeping you from prosperity. It doesn’t matter if you are an individual looking to get to the next level; if you are a couple looking to combine your finances and set yourself up for future financial security; if you are a small business owner seeking to expand your business; or a corporate professional just looking to secure your financial independence and retire early. This course will teach you the tools you need to achieve your financial goals.
You will leave the Millionaire Mind 3-Day Intensive Course knowing what your money mindset is, and with the ability to change it. You may not know that how you view money can affect how much you earn, keep, and invest. At the 3-Day Course you will take a test to assess your subconscious conditioning of money, and learn how to use several tools that will help you reprogram your money mindset for prosperity, and ultimate success.
You will also learn to create your own financial vision, set goals, and identify potential income-growth opportunities. In the Workbook you will receive at the 3-Day Course you will get the easiest Money Management System. This system will help you as an individual, as a professional, as a small business owner, or you as a couple to categorize, manage, and grow your current income.
Finally, you will define an action plan to reach your full financial potential, setting clear goals with realistic timelines so you can track your progress. That’s not all. . . upon completion of the Course you will gain access to a 90-Day Workbook and Home Learning Online Course, in addition to other valuable tools that will help you stay on-track after you have graduated!

description.text:
10 am - 4 pm Coronado Home Tour
10am - 4 pm "The District PHX" Street Fair
50+ local vendors, food trucks and live entertainment
The Coronado Neighborhood Association welcomes you to the 2018 Coronado Home Tour. Once again, we will gather at Coronado Park and enjoy food surrounded by music, a lively street fair and historically modern homes open to tour.
This year's tour will highlight both homes with a preserved history and ones that are fully renovated. Coronado is home to many types of architecture including Craftsman and and California bungalows, Spanish and Pueblo revival, Tudor style homes and Early / Transitional Ranch style homes, among others.
Home Tour tickets can be purchased in advance online for $15 or on the day of the event for $20 cash or credit. Pick up your wrist band (your pass to the homes on tour) and Home Tour Guide at the ticket booth in Coronado Park.
VEHICLE PARKING: Coronado is a residential neighborhood, so you may park in front of any home throughout the area and walk to Coronado Park (two blocks north of McDowell Rd. between 12th and 13th Streets). Please be courteous of residents and do not block driveways. Please obey all posted traffic signs.
BIKE PARKING: We encourage you to ride your bike to the event. There will be several bike racks available at Coronado Park and in front of each location on the tour so you can lock your bike up. Just make sure to pick up your bike by 4pm.
*This event takes place rain or shine. Refunds will not be provided

name.text: VegOut! Scottsdale Vegan Beer & Food Festival
name.html: VegOut! Scottsdale Vegan Beer & Food Festival

description.text:
VegOut! Scottsdale Beer & Food Festival is a Foodie event, celebrating the Vegan Lifestyle and an educational experience for those who want to discover more about the many benefits of Vegan Fare & how great it tastes!
Event Hours
Saturday, March 17th, 2018 10:00am - 7:00pm
Sunday, March 18th, 2018 11:00am - 5:00pm



Expand your palate!

Food & Beverage Vendors will sell, serve, give away or sample healthy vegan food & drink alternatives. VegOut! Scottsdale is a compilation of Vegan food & drink vendors, speakers & vegan-friendly gear including clothing, skin care & artwork. The atmosphere is set with local bands & a DJ. The focus is on Local businesses & locally sourced ingredients.
VegOut! Scottsdale takes place along the Scottsdale Waterfront, from the Stetson Bridge to the Soleri Plaza.
MAP

                          VegOut! Scottsdale is proud to be Collaborating with

                                                    Local First Arizona

FAQs
What is Vegan?
It's not just about what you eat, it is a lifestyle.

A vegan diet is richly diverse with exciting foods made from fruits, vegetables, nuts, grains, seeds, beans and pulses. From Pastries & Pizzas to Beer & Wine; all your favorite things are prepared with plant-based ingredients. Any foodie would not miss this opportunity to explore the Vegan Category of Delicious Food & Drink.
A Vegan lifestyle extends beyond food. Clothing, Accessories, Makeup, Skin Care & even Artwork are produced without the exploitation of animals. VegOut! Scottsdale has 100+ vendors so you can Eat, Drink & Shop Vegan!
Will there be live entertainment?
Absolutely! We will make band, demonstration & speaker announcements very soon!!
Can I use my ticket for either Saturday and/or Sunday?
Yes! Your ticket is valid for Saturday or Sunday or Both!
Are tickets available at the gate?
Yes! It is a good idea to pre-purchase your tickets on EventBrite. Ticket prices increase by $10 at the gate.
Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
VegOut Scottsdale is open to all Ages. Children 12 years and younger get in for free. (no tickets neccessary for the kids!)
Drinking age will be checked at the entrance. Visitors 21 years & older will receive a wristband. Wristbands are required to purchase alcoholic beverages.
What is Kombucha?
Kombucha tea is a fermented non-alcoholic drink made with tea, sugar, bacteria and yeast. It's yummie!!
What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
FREE public parking is located at:

6900 E Camelback Rd, Scottsdale. 
7014 E Camelback Rd, Scottsdale
Local Street Parking 

Uber/Lyft pick up & drop off is on Soleri Rd at N. Marshall Way. 
Can I Bring my Dog?
Dogs are permitted. They MUST be leashed & their waste be removed. If Fido gets Fiesty, he will be asked to leave.
What's the refund policy?
Tickets are not refundable. Events are considered RAIN or SHINE. No refunds will be given due to inclement weather.
How do I apply to be a vendor?
Vegan Food, Drink & Product Vendors are welcome to apply. Vendor Application. 
Brought to you by:

name.text: tastytrade presents: THE HE SAID, SHE SAID 2018 Tour; Phoenix
name.html: tastytrade presents: THE HE SAID, SHE SAID 2018 Tour; Phoenix

description.text:
The He Said, She Said Tour is BACK for 2018! 

Tom, Tony, Liz, Jenny, and Dr. Jim are bringing tastytrade to your city. Follow along as the gang guides you on a journey focusing on unique trading opportunities in 2018! Participate in our brand new, tastytrade original probabilities game. 
tastynation, this is your chance to meet the gang, as well as mingle with other tastytraders in your city!
The He Said, She Said Tour 2018 - where tasty meets the nation!
Doors open 8:00 AM! Be sure to PRINT your tickets to ensure a smooth check-in process.
Getting to the venue:
Parking: If you drive there is metered street parking available on the neighboring streets, as well as pay lots and garages nearby.
Nearest pay lots are located on 3rd Avenue. One (which is cash only) is located directly behind Crescent Ballroom on the northeast corner of 3rd Avenue and Van Buren St. the other accepts credit card and is located just a bit farther north on the east side of 3rd Avenue.
(Please note that tastytrade will not be reimbursing for parking.) 
Uber and/or Lyft are also great options.
Regarding public transportation, a major light rail and bus station is located just 1 block away.
Public transportation via bus or train schedule can be found @ www.valleymetro.org.

Hotels near the Venue:

The Westin Phoenix Downtown
Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix Downtown
Renaissance Phoenix Downtown
Sheraton Grand Phoenix
Kimpton Hotel Palomar Phoenix
Hotel San Carlos
 
Budget options also available just down the street:
Rodeway Inn Downtown Phoenix
America’s Best Value Inn

Breakfast Places near Venue:
Even Stevens
The Grand
Breakfast Club
Phoenix Public Market Cafe


 IF you are UNABLE to attend, please CANCEL your ticket!
Just log in to Eventbrite, go to the Tickets page, and locate your order. Click "Your Order" to view order details, and then select "Cancel Order" to cancel your registration. We'll send you and the event organizer an email confirming the cancellation.
1. Manage your order.
2. Choose "Cancel Order."
3. Select "Yes, cancel this order."
4. You'll receive an email confirming the cancellation. 

Questions?Please email support@tastytrade.com

name.text: Global Citizenship in an Age of Anger
name.html: Global Citizenship in an Age of Anger

description.text:
How can we explain the origins of the great wave of paranoid hatreds that seem inescapable in our close-knit world—from American ‘shooters’ and ISIS to Trump, from a rise in vengeful nationalism across the world to racism and misogyny on social media?
Join us as Pankaj Mishra addresses public bewilderment by casting a gaze back to the eighteenth century before leading us to the present, speaking to the historical root of the world’s major nationalisms. In a time of heightened, hardened nationalisms, it becomes imparative to retrieve some inclusive visions, emphasizing the common humanity that transcends local affiliations and identities. But is this recovery possible in the present global economic regime, one that benefits a transnational elite and provokes many of the left-behind into hardline nationalism? Mishra will explore some of the tensions that went into the making of Asian nationalisms, offering his perspecitve on how to rescue cosmopolitanism from the transnational.



Pankaj Mishra is a novelist, essayist, literary critic, lecturer, and reporter who travels the world writing on a wide range of topics, including globalization, the Dalai Lama, Bollywood, and the “Talibanization” of South Asia. He regularly contributes to the New York Review of Books, the New York Times, the Guardian, and the New Statesman, and has written for too many international magazines and newspapers to list. In his latest book, The Age of Anger: A History of the Present (2017), Mishra casts his gaze back to the eighteenth century before leading us to the present to explain the origins of the great wave of paranoid hatreds that seem inescapable in our close-knit world: from American shooters and ISIS to Donald Trump, to a rise in vengeful nationalism across the world, to racism and misogyny on social media. Mishra was born in North India and completed his MA in English Literature at the Jawaharlal Nehru University in New Delhi.His first book was Butter Chicken in Ludhiana: Travels in Small Town India (1995), a travelogue which described the social and cultural changes in India in the new context of globalization. His novel The Romantics (2000) an ironic tale of people longing for fulfillment in cultures other than their own, won the Los Angles Times’ Art Seidenbaum award for first fiction. His book An End to Suffering: The Buddha in the World (2004), mixes memoir, history, and philosophy while attempting to explore the Buddha’s relevance to contemporary times. Temptations of the West: How to be Modern in India, Pakistan and Beyond, describes Mishra’s travels through Kashmir, Bollywood, Afghanistan, Tibet, Nepal, and other parts of South and Central Asia. Like his previous books, it was featured in the New York Times‘ 100 Best Books of the Year. Published in 2012, From the Ruins of Empire: The Revolt Against the West and the Remaking of Asia was shortlisted for the Lionel Gelber prize in Canada, the Orwell Prize in the U.K, and the Asia Society Bernard Schwartz Book Award in the United States. It won the Crossword Award for Best Nonfiction in 2013. In 2014, it became the first book by a non-Western writer to win Germany’s prestigious Leipzig Book Award for European Understanding. In 2013, he published A Great Clamour: Encounters with China and its Neighbours. Mishra was a visiting professor at Wellesley College in 2001, 2004, and 2006. In 2004-2005 he received a fellowship at the Cullman Center for Writers and Scholars, New York Public Library. For 2007-08, he was the Visiting Fellow at the Department of English, University College, London. In 2009, he was nominated a Fellow of the Royal Society of Literature. In 2014, he received Yale University’s Windham-Campbell Literature Prize.

description.text:
On Friday, February 23, 2018, from 1 pm to 5 pm, at the ASU College of Law,  MAJORS|AZ  hosts the first annual  Arizona State Law and Policy Symposium.
3 CLE credits will be available for attorneys. The documents below are provided in preparation for each presentation.  This material may also be utilized to meet the requirements for CLE. Attendance sign-in and the CLE certificate will be available the day of the event for those interested in obtaining CLE credit.
This program may qualify for up to 3 CLE credits and 0 ethics credits.
Professionals attending, please contact msavary@asu.edu for assistance with reserved parking.




REGISTRATION | 1-1:15

WELCOME AND INTRODUCTION | 1:15-1:30


Dean Doug Sylvester, Sandra Day O’Connor College of Law



LITIGATING WITH THE ARIZONA CONSTITUTION | 1:30-2:30
Presented in conjunction with the Arizona State Criminal Law Association


Paul Bender: Professor and Dean Emeritus, Sandra Day O’Connor College of Law


Clint Bolick: Associate Justice, Arizona Supreme Court 


Stanley Feldman: Chief Justice, Arizona Supreme Court (1992-1997)


Kory Langhofer: Managing Attorney, Statecraft


CLE: http://bit.ly/litigatingazconstitutionCLE
This panel may qualify for up to 1 CLE credit and 0 ethics credits. 

WOMEN AND THE JUDICIARY: Path to the Bench | 2:40-3:40
Presented in conjunction with the Women Law Students’ Association


Rebecca Berch: Chief Justice, Arizona Supreme Court (2009-2014)


Kate King: Deputy General Counsel, Governor Doug Ducey (2015-2017)


Jennifer Perkins: Judge, Arizona Court of Appeals Division One


Amanda Reeve: Member, Maricopa County Commission on Trial Court Appointments 


CLE: http://bit.ly/womenjudiciaryCLE
This panel may qualify for up to 1 CLE credit and 0 ethics credits. 

WATER LAW IN ARIZONA | 3:50-4:50
Presented in conjunction with the Environmental Law Society


Rhett Larson: Professor & Morrison Fellow, Sandra Day O’Connor College of Law


Brian Payne: Water Policy Analyst, Arizona Municipal Water Users Association


Sarah Porter: Director, Kyl Center for Water Policy, Morrison Institute for Public Policy


CLE: http://bit.ly/waterlawCLEs
This panel may qualify for up to 1 CLE credit and 0 ethics credits.

name.text: An Evening with Michael Horton presented by White Horse Inn (Phoenix)
name.html: An Evening with Michael Horton presented by White Horse Inn (Phoenix)

description.text:
Discipleship in a Selfie Age
We live in a time when religious affiliation is on the wane, and autonomy is on the rise. People increasingly believe that they are not accountable to anyone. They begin to see themselves as the measure of all things. In such a world, there are no ultimate standards of truth, goodness or beauty, but only subjective preferences which is why many have come to believe in our day “we are what we feel.”
Join us as Mike Horton challenges us to ask ourselves whether we too have bought into many of the beliefs and assumptions of our contemporary culture, with its stress on consumer preference and individual autonomy. This message of hope reorients our hearts and encourages us to raise our eyes to heaven (from our Facebook and Instagram accounts).

description.text:
Join us for our GH Fantasy Weekend on Saturday, March 24, 2018 at The Sheraton Phoenix Airport Hotel Tempe. We are bringing some of the hottest "General Hospital" stars to Arizona!! The GH Fantasy Weekend will be hosted by Laura Wright, a fan favorite from ABC's General Hospital. The event will also feature Wil DeVry, Wally Kurth, Donnell Turner, Maura West, Bradford Anderson and Finola Hughes!-you'll get to see all of them for a star studded afternoon in Arizona! Come spend the day with your GH favorites!
Platinum, $235.00- includes a 2 hour meet/greet with the actors for autographs and photo ops plus a 90 minute show- limited to 100 tickets. Doors will open at 9 am. for a 10 a.m. Platinum event. Limit of 3 autographs per star. Also includes premium seating for the show!
VIP, $134.00- includes the 90 minute show as well a group photo op at the end of the show. Doors will open at 12 p.m. for a 1 p.m. show. VIP photo op is one photo op per person with the 6 actors in a group, VIP begins immediately following the show. Bring your own camera for the photo op.
General Admission, $84.00 -  Doors open at 12:00 pm for 1 pm ninety minute show featuring Q & A, interviews, and fan fun.
All tickets are non-refundable Bring your cameras but no videotaping allowed.  *Actors can be subject to change due to Acts of God, illness, means of transportation or anything else beyond the control of the Artist. Ages 10 and up admitted!

description.text:
Security Titans is a ground-breaking event, bringing the biggest names in information security together -- all in one day, on a single stage, to give the nation's booming security industry access to the very best InfoSec thought leadership in one focused event. Join us on Friday, February 23 as we invite the best and brightest from all of over the world to participate in a unique day of intimate and focused content delivered by a set of all-star speakers.
Refreshments, Catered Lunch, and hosted Cocktail Reception all included!
7 hours of CPE credit!

8:00 - 9:00 | Registration/networking
9:00 - 10:30 | Brian Krebs
10:30 - 11:00 | Networking break
11:00 - 12:30 | Frank Abagnale
12:30 - 1:30 | Lunch (Jono Zalay)
1:30 - 3:00 | Ann Barron-DiCamillo
3:00 - 3:30 | Networking break
3:30 - 5:00 | Kevin Mitnick
5:00 - 7:00 | Cocktail reception






 
FAQs
 
What are my parking options?
     CONVENIENT, FREE PARKING IS AVAILABLE AT THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS:
     Civic Center Library Garage – Drinkwater Boulevard at East Second Street     Civic Center Lot and Garage – Wells Fargo Avenue     Old Town Parking Corral – East Second Street and Brown Avenue     Pepperwood Lot – East First Avenue at Buckboard Trail
 

Is recording allowed at the event?
There is no recording of presentations allowed at Security Titans.  You may take pictures in the lobby area.
 
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Please direct all questions to programdirector@phoenix.issa.org
 
What's the refund policy?
7 days: Attendees can receive refunds up to 7 days before the event start date.
 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
No, we will have your registration information on site.  However, bringing your printed ticket will expedite your registration.
 
Can I update my registration information?
Yes
 
Where can I get more information?
Check out the event website at www.securitytitans.org

Learn about the science and technology behind our new products and prepare to be SKINSPIRED. Cocktails, prizes, swag bags and exclusive offers for 1 night only.

Don't miss out on the biggest IMAGE Skincare launches of the year - get your 2018 products in your business before the rest of the world with exclusive event-only discounts on ALL products.! Learn about the science and technology behind our new products and prepare to be SKINSPIRED. Cocktails, prizes, swag bags and exclusive offers for 1 night only.

Curious about bringing IMAGE Skincare into your business?

You are most definitely welcome to join us for the festivities! We suggest you set up your professional Image Skincare account prior to attending as the discounts and ordering is limited to current up to date account holders. It is a simple process and there is no initial obligation to set up your account. Please go to www.imageskincare.com and follow the professional prompts. This process is simple but may take a few business days to set up properly so please have your account in place 5 days prior to the event. .

*Licensed esthetics or medical professionals and media only. All others should contact host for additional information on how to register for event.

description.text: The annual Living History Program is chaired by the Phoenix Chapter of Jack & Jill of America, Inc., the Phoenix Chapter of The Links, Inc., and the Grand Boule Of The Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity, Gamma Mu Boule of Phoenix. The mission of the program is to expose Phoenix area youth to prominent African American figures (Honorees) in the Valley of the Sun, who represent a selected professional discipline and are honored at a formal program. Teams are formed and pared with mentors from the organizations.  Through a series of educational enrichment activities, these teams collect information through interviews and prepare formal introductions of the honorees at the Living History Awards Ceremony and Reception in February. This year’s event will take place on Saturday, February 24, 2018.

description.text:
Latin Sol Festival 2018 is coming! After our hugely successful inaugural festival in 2017, this year we have expanded the event to be an all-weekend dance extravaganza! *PRIORITY REGISTRATION NOW OPEN FOR ASU STUDENTS/FACULTY!*(Non-ASU affilliated community registration will be announced shortly. If you are an instructor/lecturer/performer, please contact your Latin Sol staff liason for the registration code.)
Latin Sol is a weekend festival that integrates multiple social dance communities. The festival is a three-day event composed of social/performance dance workshops, lectures by visiting guest artists, evening social dancing, dance performances, and more. Latin Sol encourages exposure to learning with local and out of state artists to provide varied teaching perspectives while experiencing crossover interactions with multiple dance communities. Participants will also have the opportunity to attend lectures to engage in a dialogue with experienced dancers and organizers in the industry.
The event is held in early April each year on ASU's campus, hosted by the ASU Salsa Club. Latin Sol is primarily by students/alumni, for the students/alumni. Although designed primarily with the ASU community in mind, Latin Sol also welcomes and cherishes participation by outside members of the dance community. The event bridges these communities and encourages a unification of all dance lovers.

description.text: Built in 1969, Big Surf Waterpark is America’s Original Waterpark boasting one of the largest wave pools in the world, Waikiki Beach. Nestled on 20 acres in Arizona on the northern tip of Tempe and just south of Scottsdale, Big Surf has remained an Arizona icon for over 40 years and features dozens of other thrilling water features all in a safe and family friendly atmosphere.

name.text: Classy But Sassy Professionals Launch Party
name.html: Classy But Sassy Professionals Launch Party

description.text:
Come out and celebrate the launching of Classy But Sassy Professionals. Classy But Sassy Professionals serves as a networking/support group for Black Professional Women. 
How many of us are the only minoirity in our department, or in the whole company? How many us feel alone, or like we have no support? How many of need to vent, but don't have the proper resources to receive the proper advice? How many of us are seeking like minded individuals to share experiences, and network with? 
Joining the Classy But Sassy Professional community will offer you a safe venting space, a professional network, and resources, and stories to learn from as you are embarking on your career. Whether you are just starting your career and need help transitioning into the workplace, have been in your career for quite some time and seeking a strong support system, or are ending your career and can offer some advice to others, this community is for you. 

This is a FREE event, yes, FREE event. Light hors d'oeuvres will be served, as well as a Champagne toast. There will be live entertainment, vendors to shop from, and many more suprises. Please come to show your support for Professional Black Women!

name.text: Scottsdale Shamrock Crawl - St. Patrick's Day Bar Crawl in Old Town!
name.html: Scottsdale Shamrock Crawl - St. Patrick's Day Bar Crawl in Old Town!

description.text:
Everyone is Irish on St. Patrick's Day! Come decked out in green as we celebrate the right way with other fun-loving people in Old Town!!
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Tickets include Admission, Three Penny Drink Vouchers to Use on the Crawl & MORE!

WHERE: Old Town's Best Bars including Bevvy, Dierks Bentley's Whiskey Row, El Hefe, Old Town Gringos, Wasted Grain and more bars TBA! (subject to change)
WHY:  It's St. Patrick's Day! Why not?!
WRISTBANDS: You MUST wear your wristband during the crawl!
FREE TICKETS/RAISE MONEY FOR YOUR CAUSE: See below for more info.

GET TO AND FROM THE EVENT FOR FREE! Use code 'CTS2' for 2 FREE rides from Lyft (up to $5 off each of your first two rides) Sign up now HERE! 
PHOTO CONTEST: Enter to win our PHOTO CONTEST by posting pictures to Facebook or Instagram using "#ScottsdaleBarCrawls" and "#ScottsdaleShamrockCrawl" Our panel of judges will go through the pictures and winners will be contacted after the crawl! Be a Scottsdale Shamrock Crawl Champ, and post a picture from every bar!
CRAWL SCHEDULE: The crawl schedule will be announced on Friday, March 16th in the afternoon, please check back for details!
PACKET PICK-UP INFO:  You can pick up your packet between 9am and 1pm on the day of the crawl at bars TBA.
*Please note the first penny drink voucher expires at 11am & the second expires at 12pm*
The Shamrock Crawl is finally coming to Scottsdale! Check out photos from the Chicago Shamrock Crawl in the video below!

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES: For questions, sponsorship opportunities, and press inquiries, please email Info@ScottsdaleBarCrawls.com
FREE TICKETS/RAISE MONEY FOR YOUR CAUSE:-Fundraising Opportunity: Are you trying to raise money for a certain cause? Email Info@ScottsdaleBarCrawls.com for more info!-Celebrate your birthday on the crawl and your ticket is free! Email Info@ScottsdaleBarCrawls.com for more info-Want to earn a free ticket and some cash for spreading the word? Email Info@ScottsdaleBarCrawls.com for more info!



FINE PRINT:  All Guests must be 21+ with ID.  We will crawl rain or shine!  NO REFUNDS! If you cannot find your ticket please contact Eventbrite.com directly, please do NOT email us as there is nothing we can do. Must be 21 years old to participate. Participating venues and advertised times are subject to change. Scottsdale Bar Crawls promotes safety and urges all participants to drink responsibly. Participating venues reserve the right to refuse entry to guests who are deemed intoxicated (or otherwise unfit) upon arrival. No refunds will be given. Participants must bring their Print At Home Ticket to the registration venue. No refunds. All sales are final. If a venue is at capacity then you may have to wait or proceed to another venue. Do not be late for registration. Prices are subject to change while supplies last.

*Unfortunately the Eventbrite system does not allow us to restrict people who are underage from buying tickets.  If you are not 21 and purchase a ticket, you will not be allowed into the event.*

name.text: Arizona Veterans Hall of Fame 12th Annual Patriotic Gala
name.html: Arizona Veterans Hall of Fame 12th Annual Patriotic Gala

description.text:
Join the Arizona Veterans Hall of Fame for its 12th Annual Patriotic Gala to celebrate our military service men and women past and present!
The Arizona Veterans Hall of Fame Society’s Patriotic Gala, formerly known as the Copper Sword Gala, has grown to become one of the most anticipated events of the year and attracts our service men and women, retired military, political, business, civic and philanthropic leaders from around the state to honor leaders who are a voice for those who serve our nation. Event proceeds fund scholarships and a wide variety of veteran projects of both a national and local character. As a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, all or a portion of any contribution is tax-deductible.
Cocktail Reception - 5:30 p.m.
Dinner and Program - 6:30 p.m.
Dress Code: Business or Cocktail
Local TV personality and journalist, Carey Pena, will be our gala emcee and honorees to include:


Ms. Susan Kee - 2018 Copper Sword Award recipient


Snell & Wilmer, L.L.P. - 2018 Copper Eagle Award recipient


The Honorable Steve Smith - 2018 Copper Shield Award recipient


The Honorable Jamescita Peshlakai - 2018 Copper Star Award recipient


A special room rate of $159 per night/double occupancy has been arranged at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Scottsdale Resort, so please visit http://group.embassysuites.com/AZVeteransHallofFame  or call (480) 949-1414 for reservations.

name.text: Sustainability Short Films with Peter Byck & The Soil Carbon Cowboys (not a band…)
name.html: Sustainability Short Films with Peter Byck & The Soil Carbon Cowboys (not a band…)

description.text:
Carbon Nation director Peter Byck has spent the last 4 years filming innovative ranchers focused on regenerating their soils first, growing grass second, and producing healthy food third. Could these ranchers be storing enough CO2 in their soils to help slow climate change? Byck helped form a team of scientists to find out how grazing can regenerate soils, drawdown CO2, increase biodiversity, improve animal well-being and help ranchers make a good living. Join Byck for an evening of short films and conversation about science communication, and what scientists can learn from leading ranchers.
Doors open at 6:00 p.m., Films with discussion begin at 6:30 p.m.

name.text: Amma Sri Karunamayi visits Phoenix, AZ
name.html: Amma Sri Karunamayi visits Phoenix, AZ

description.text:
INDIVIDUAL BLESSING, MEDITATION RETREAT, & HOMA & RUDRA HOMA SACRED FIRE CEREMONY
We are very pleased to announce that Amma Sri Karunamayi will be holding her Spiritual programs again this year in Phoenix, AZ. The Individual Blessings, Meditation Retreat and Homa programs will take place at the Indo American Cultural Center.


FRIDAY, MARCH 23Individual Blessings/Saraswati Diksha – 11 AM to 5 PM
On Friday, March 23 we will have Individual Blessings/Saraswati Dikshas and Divine Discourse, 11 AM to 5 PM. The program will held at the Indo American Cultural Center - 2809 W. Maryland Ave. Phoenix AZ 85017. Individual Blessing programs are free and open to everyone. This is a very special opportunity for you to speak one-on-one with Amma and convey any specific questions, concerns, or blessing requests to her. (Please note: that each person may only receive one individual blessing per yearly tour)
While Individual Blessings are free, there is a nominal suggested donation for Saraswati Mantra Diksha. Individual Blessings are offered on a first come, first served basis. Please be prepared to relax for some time in the charged atmosphere of the hall.
Please note that due to the large number of people attending this program, individuals arriving after 2:30 pm are not guaranteed an Individual Blessing with Amma.Saraswati Mantra Diksha is available for students, ages 4-24. Those who wish to receive Diksha should come fully bathed or showered (with head and hair washed) and dressed in modest, white attire.Lunch will be served so that people can stay and enjoy Amma's presence. For more information about Individual Blessing please see: www.karunamayi.org/guide-to-individual-blessings
 
SATURDAY, MARCH 24One Day Meditation Retreat – 8 AM to 6 PM
Location: Bharatiya Ekta Mandir - 2804 W. Maryland Ave. Phoenix AZ 85017http://karunamayi.org/guide-to-meditation-retreats
All programs are free except the meditation retreat (Early registration until March 16 - $102 for Full Day and $62 for Half Day. After March 16th - $122 for Full Day and $77 for Half Day ) and the Saraswati Diksha for children (a very nominal fee).

SUNDAY, MARCH 25Homa (Sacred Fire Ceremony) – 9 AM – 1 PM
MONDAY, MARCH 26Rudra Homa (Sacred Fire Ceremony) – 5 PM – 8 PM
Location: Indo American Cultural Center - 2809 W. Maryland Ave. Phoenix AZ 85017 www.karunamayi.org/guide-to-sacred-fire-ceremoniesIf you have any questions please contact the Phoenix City Co-ordinator at: Phoenix@Karunamayi.org.We look forward to a blissful time with Amma basking in her radiant love, taking in her blessings, bhajans and absorbing her Divine grace and wisdom!

To find out more about Amma's world wide non-profit charities or to help with donations click on either of the buttons below.


Also visit our spiritual gift shop where what you buy goes to help others!
View Amma's 2018 US Tour schedule: www.karunamayi.org/world-tour/north-america.
 Om Shanti Shanti Shanti Lokah Samastah Sukhino Bhavantu

name.text: Steven Pinker Presents "Why Free Speech is Fundamental"
name.html: Steven Pinker Presents "Why Free Speech is Fundamental"

description.text:
Is free speech merely a symbolic talisman, like a national flag or motto? Is it just one of many values that we trade off against each other? Or is free speech fundamental — a right which, if not absolute, should be abrogated only in carefully circumscribed cases? Join Steven Pinker on Wednesday, April 4, 2018, for "Why Free Speech is Fundamental." 
Pinker argues that free speech is indeed fundamental, and that it’s important to remind ourselves why and to have the reasons at our fingertips when that right is called into question. In his Boston Globe opt-ed, Pinker discusses that "campus speech codes, disinvited commencement speakers, jailed performance artists, exiled leakers, a blogger condemned to a thousand lashes by one of our closest allies, and the massacre of French cartoonists have forced the democratic world to examine the roots of its commitment to free speech." 
Steven Pinker is an experimental psychologist who conducts research in visual cognition, psycholinguistics, and social relations. He grew up in Montreal and earned his BA from McGill and his PhD from Harvard. Currently Johnstone Professor of Psychology at Harvard, he has also taught at Stanford and MIT. He has won numerous prizes for his research, his teaching, and his nine books, including "The Language Instinct," "How the Mind Works," "The Blank Slate," "The Better Angels of Our Nature," and "The Sense of Style." He is an elected member of the National Academy of Sciences, a two-time Pulitzer Prize finalist, a Humanist of the Year, a recipient of nine honorary doctorates, and one of Foreign Policy’s “World’s Top 100 Public Intellectuals” and Time’s “100 Most Influential People in the World Today.” He is Chair of the Usage Panel of the American Heritage Dictionary, and writes frequently for The New York Times, The Guardian, and other publications. His tenth book, to be published in February 2018, is called "Enlightenment Now: The Case for Reason, Science, Humanism, and Progress."
This event is last in the 2017/2018 “Free Speech and Intellectual Diversity in Higher Education and American Society” series sponsored by the School of Civic and Economic Thought and Leadership and co-sponsored by the Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication and the Sandra Day O’Connor School of Law at Arizona State University. This discussion will be held at the Old Main on the Tempe campus, followed by a reception from 6:15-7 p.m. Parking will be available in the Fulton Center Parking Structure for $3 per hour.
Continuing Legal Education Credit (CLE) is available with this event. The State Bar of Arizona does not approve or accredit CLE activities for the Mandatory Continuing Legal Education requirement. This activity may qualify for up to 1.0 hours toward your annual CLE requirement for the State Bar of Arizona, including 0.0 hour(s) of professional responsibility.
For more information about the newly established School of Civic and Economic Thought and Leadership, please visit scetl.asu.edu. For questions about this event, email SCETLEvents@asu.edu or call 480-965-0155.

description.text:
Join us on March 14th to celebrate National RDN/NDTR Day, as we return to the Arizona Capitol Complex for AZAND’s Annual Legislative Day! AZAND members will be encouraging our legislators to Go Further with Food in order to advance the food system in Arizona, improve the health of Arizonans, and learn about the important role that RDNs and NDTRs play in promoting a healthy Arizona.
The event will include opportunities to connect with our state legislators and learn about current legislative issues that impact the food system and nutrition landscape in Arizona. 


March 5, 2018 - Pre-event webinars 
6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Nutirtion Advocacy 101:  This training will provide attendees with a background of how the legislative process works in Arizona, tools for staying up-to-date with nutrition-related policy topics in Arizona, and a walkthrough of a sample meeting with legislators. 
7:00 PM - 8:00 PM - AZAND Legislative Priorities for the 2018 Legislative Session: This training will provide attendees with an overview and talking points for the legsislative issues we will be advocating for during our meetings with Legisaltors on March 14th. {Attendees must watch this webinar prior to March 14th}
*These webinar trainings will be recorded for those unable to attend the live sessions. Links to access the recorded webinars will be sent to attendees after the live webinars conclude on March 5th. 

March 14, 2018 - AZAND Annual Legislativ Day 
7:30 – 8:00 – Networking & Registration 
8:00 – 8:15 – Welcome & Overview of Schedule 
8:15 – 9:00 – Group Meetings: Prepare to Meet with Legislators 
9:00 – 2:00 – Meetings with Legislators 
2:00 – 3:00 – Debrief & Wrap-Up 
*Lunch will be delivered at 12:00 PM - Attendees will break for lunch as meetings allow. 


FAQs
Do I need to register separately for the webinars? 
Nope! Registered attendees will automatically be registered for pre-event webinars. 
What if I can't attend the live pre-event webinars?
Don't stress! Pre-event webinars will be recorded and links will be sent to all registered attendees after the live sessions. 
Where do I park? 
Arizona Department of Health Services: Free parking is available in the ADHS parking garage located on 18th street and Monroe.
Capitol Complex:  Free parking is available in the Wesley Bolin Plaza parking lot (1616 W Washington St, Phoenix, AZ 85007). That's located just east of the Capitol building, with one south entrance off Jefferson between 16th and 17th Avenue (Jefferson is a one way street in this area, going east) and another parking lot entrance on the north on Adams (Adams is a one-way street going west). 
What if I have to arrive late or leave early? 
E-mail Jessie Gruner at jessiegreen10@gmail.com to let the policy team plan legislative meetings accordingly. 
Questions/Concerns: Contact - Jessie Gruner at jessiegreen10@gmail.com or (505) 980-5971.

description.text:
WHAT IS SMALL BUSINESS EXPO?
Small Business Expo is America’s BIGGEST & most anticipated business-to-business networking event, trade show & conference for business owners, entrepreneurs, start-ups, decision-makers or anyone who works for a small business or is interested in starting a small business.  Small Business Expo is a FREE one-day event for small businesses to network, build new business relationships, attend cutting-edge and business-building workshops/seminars, exchange ideas, shop for new vendors and learn from leading industry experts. If you are serious about growing or starting your business, Small Business Expo is a "MUST ATTEND" event for you.
 
WHAT IS THE COST TO ATTEND?


It's FREE TO ATTEND!

There are other upgraded premium badges that include items like our Reserved Seating, Lead Scanner & Happy Hour Open Bar (see below Badge Chart).
If you prefer to Sponsor or Exhibit at Small Business Expo, please call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.

 
WHY ATTEND?


Network with thousands of businesses, entrepreneurs & start-ups


Attend 25+ Business workshops & seminars to help your business grow


Fast-paced speed-networking sessions to make new contacts quickly


Learn about new cutting-edge products and services 


Establish hundreds of new & valuable contacts


Interact with the movers and shakers of your industry.


Leave the show with hundreds of qualified sales leads 


WHO CAN ATTEND?


Anyone can attend Small Business Expo. We encourage anyone that currently operates/owns a small business or anyone that works for a small business to attend.

If you don't currently own a small business or work for a small business, that's okay too! Small Business Expo is the perfect place for you to come learn how to start & grow your own business. We have FREE workshops & seminars about building your own business, an exhibitor hall with great products/services to help you, speed networking & more!
Whether you are already an established business, a start-up, a Fortune 100 or anything in between, if you care about small business, we want to see you at Small Business Expo.

 
YOUR BADGE OPTIONS:

 
 
WANT TO EXHIBIT YOUR PRODUCT/SERVICE & GET SALES LEADS?
If your product/service targets business owners, exhibiting at this show is a must. Business owners attend Small Business Expo to shop for innovative products & services that will help their business grow. Nowhere else can you reach thousands of business owners and make on-the-spot sales in one day!  
For more info, call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.
 
 
SMALL BUSINESS EXPO AGENDA
 
CLICK HERE To start building your own personal schedule! You don’t want to miss out on these wonderful sessions, Workshops, Speed Networking, Main Stage Presentations, AND MORE! Start planning your day at Small Business Expo now!
 
 

 
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:
What are the Expo Hours?
The Expo Hall is open from 9am - 5pm.  
The final Main Stage Presentation is from 4:30pm-6pm.
 
How do I register & can I register more than one person?
You can absolutely register more than one person and we encourage that! Attending is always more fun with groups!
To register, simply choose your Badge type above and select the number of tickets you need. Then click "REGISTER" to begin your registration process. Each person attending will need to be registered. 
Please use a DIFFERENT email address for each person registering.
  
Is there a dress code?
The Dress code is Business Casual.
 
Is there an age limit to enter the Expo?
Attendees must be 18 or older to attend Small Business Expo.
 
What are my parking options at the Event?
Parking is available. Please click HERE for parking information.
 
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Please contact clientservices@theshowproducers.com or call (212)404-2345.
 
What is the Lead Scanner App? 
Our Lead Scanner App is an excellent way to collect valuable contact information from each person you meet at Small Business Expo. The App is available on Android & iPhone. With this App you scan the QR code found on a person's badge at the Expo. Once you scan the QR Code, that person's contact information that was provided to us when they registered will appear on your phone to save (i.e., First Name, Last Name, Email Address, Phone #, Company Name, Job Title & Zip Code). You can then put notes and mark the lead as Cold, Warm or Hot for future follow up. The App also allows you to export all of your scans into an Excel Spreadsheet that you can then upload into your CRM, Email Marketing Software, Contact Database, etc. For more info about our Lead Scanner App, please click HERE.

How do I use the Lead Scanner App?
You will receive a separate email from us with details on how to download and use the Lead Scanner App on your smartphone (along with your License Code).  It is only available on iPhone & Android Devices. You may scan as many attendee & exhibitor badges as you’d like.  All contact information from that scan will be provided (name, company, phone #, email address, job title & zip code). If you have any questions or need your License Code, please visit us in the Registration Area at the Expo.
You can also CLICK HERE for additional details on how to use our App.
 
What is Beer & Biz Happy Hour?
Beer & Biz Happy Hour takes place on the Small Business Expo Exhibitor Floor from 3:30 pm-4:30 pm. Free Beer will be provided at the VIP Bar for Exhibitors and Attendees with a Gold, Platinum or Titanium Badge. We crank up the music, add Beer and everyone has a great time with some last minute networking! Please note you must be 21 years or older to consume alcohol. 
 
I want access to the Beer & Biz Happy Hour & the Lead Scanner App!
Great! Please purchase the Gold, Platinum or Titanium Badge.  These badges include both options (see the Badge Chart above for other items included with these badges). Please note you must be 21 years or older to consume alcohol and use the Open Bar.
 
What is the PRICE and what is the FEE listed on the Eventbrite options?
The "PRICE" is what Small Business Expo charges for that specific Badge Option. The "FEE" is the Eventbrite Registration processing fee. Eventbrite is a 3rd Party Registration company that we use to allow you to register for our events. 
 
I already purchased a badge but would like to upgrade to a higher level. What do I do?
Please purchase the higher level option and then contact us by email or by phone at 212.404.2345 and we will refund your other badge.  You must purchase the higher level badge first before requesting a refund for the other badge.
 
Can I update my registration contact information?
Yes. Any updates to your contact information may be made when you arrive at the Expo in our Registration Area.  We are unable to make changes over the phone or online.
 
Will my Entrance Badge be emailed or mailed to me before the Expo?
No.  You will need to check-in with us at the Expo in our Registration Area.  We will print your badge on-site and provide you with a lanyard/clip and badge holder.  We do recommend that you print and bring your EventBrite Confirmation with QR Code for quick & expedited check-in.
 
Do I have to bring my printed EventBrite Confirmation to the event?
No, but we do recommend it.  We are able to look you up by your name and/or email address at the Expo.  However, bringing your EventBrite Confirmation with QR Code will speed up your check-in process.
 
VIP Reserved Seating - how does that work?
All of our workshop rooms & the Main Stage will have a row of seats reserved just for you.  Please be sure to always have your badge displayed for access to these reserved seats.  Your badge gives you access to these seats, no other ticket is needed. This option is only available for Platinum & Titanium Badge Holders.
 
What is Priority Seating in Speed Networking?
 Speed Networking is one of our most popular areas of the show. Like "Speed Dating" you get approximately 3 mins to exchange information and network with one person. When the bell goes off, you move to the next table and meet someone different. This is a quick way to meet about 20 new people in 45-60 minutes. Priority Seating is available for Titanium Badge Holders first, followed by everyone else. This area of the Expo tends to sell out so we highly recommend purchasing a Titanium Badge if you plan to participate in this part of the show. When you arrive at the Expo and get your Badge, your Badge will give you access to Priority Seating in this area. Please look for the Priority Seating line when you arrive at this area. Priority Seating badge holders will be seated first.
 
 
What is the company promo offer in the post-show "thank you" email included in my Titanium badge? 
After the Expo, we will send out a special "THANK YOU" email to all of our registered attendees. As a Titanium Badge-Holder, we include your logo, contact Info, company description, link to your website and a special offer (optional). Please send this information to Andres@theshowproducers.com. Click Here to view a sample of this email.
 
 
The name on my registration doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?
Yes, you may update this information on-site in our Registration Area the day of the Expo.  We are unable to make changes to your registration over the phone or online.
 
Should I bring business cards to the event? Are flyers and other ads permitted?
Absolutely bring business cards, and lots of them! This is a huge networking event, we encourage networking and exchanging of business cards.  Flyers and other advertisements may not be given away unless you are an approved exhibitor.  However, you may display your business cards, flyers & other advertisements free of charge in our designated Business Card Exchange Area.
 
May I solicit my product/service to Expo Exhibitors and Sponsors?
No. We have a strict No Solicitation policy.  Please do not solicit your product/service to Exhibitors & Sponsors unless you are an Exhibitor/Sponsor with proper Exhibitor/Sponsor credentials listed on your badge. Violators will be asked to leave.  We thank you in advance for your cooperation.  If you would like to sell your product/service at the Expo, we encourage you to purchase an exhibitor space at the Expo.
 
I want to Exhibit and/or Sponsor Small Business Expo!
Great! Please contact us at (212)404-2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.
 
What is the Refund Policy?
Once a badge or Exhibitor Space is purchased, there are no refunds provided.
 
What is Small Business Expo's Terms & Conditions & Privacy Policy?
Please visit these links to review each. By registering for Small Business Expo you acknowledge that you have read and agree to both of these policies.
Terms & Conditions
Privacy Policy
description.html:
WHAT IS SMALL BUSINESS EXPO?

Small Business Expo is America’s BIGGEST & most anticipated business-to-business networking event, trade show & conference for business owners, entrepreneurs, start-ups, decision-makers or anyone who works for a small business or is interested in starting a small business.  Small Business Expo is a FREE one-day event for small businesses to network, build new business relationships, attend cutting-edge and business-building workshops/seminars, exchange ideas, shop for new vendors and learn from leading industry experts. If you are serious about growing or starting your business, Small Business Expo is a "MUST ATTEND" event for you.

 

WHAT IS THE COST TO ATTEND?

  • It's FREE TO ATTEND!

  • There are other upgraded premium badges that include items like our Reserved Seating, Lead Scanner & Happy Hour Open Bar (see below Badge Chart).
  • If you prefer to Sponsor or Exhibit at Small Business Expo, please call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.

 

WHY ATTEND?

  • Network with thousands of businesses, entrepreneurs & start-ups

  • Attend 25+ Business workshops & seminars to help your business grow

  • Fast-paced speed-networking sessions to make new contacts quickly

  • Learn about new cutting-edge products and services

  • Establish hundreds of new & valuable contacts

  • Interact with the movers and shakers of your industry.

  • Leave the show with hundreds of qualified sales leads 

WHO CAN ATTEND?

  • Anyone can attend Small Business Expo. We encourage anyone that currently operates/owns a small business or anyone that works for a small business to attend.

  • If you don't currently own a small business or work for a small business, that's okay too! Small Business Expo is the perfect place for you to come learn how to start & grow your own business. We have FREE workshops & seminars about building your own business, an exhibitor hall with great products/services to help you, speed networking & more!
  • Whether you are already an established business, a start-up, a Fortune 100 or anything in between, if you care about small business, we want to see you at Small Business Expo.

 

YOUR BADGE OPTIONS:

 

 

WANT TO EXHIBIT YOUR PRODUCT/SERVICE & GET SALES LEADS?

If your product/service targets business owners, exhibiting at this show is a must. Business owners attend Small Business Expo to shop for innovative products & services that will help their business grow. Nowhere else can you reach thousands of business owners and make on-the-spot sales in one day!  

For more info, call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.

 

 

SMALL BUSINESS EXPO AGENDA

 

CLICK HERE To start building your own personal schedule! You don’t want to miss out on these wonderful sessions, Workshops, Speed Networking, Main Stage Presentations, AND MORE! Start planning your day at Small Business Expo now!

 

 

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

What are the Expo Hours?

The Expo Hall is open from 9am - 5pm.  

The final Main Stage Presentation is from 4:30pm-6pm.

 

How do I register & can I register more than one person?

You can absolutely register more than one person and we encourage that! Attending is always more fun with groups!

To register, simply choose your Badge type above and select the number of tickets you need. Then click "REGISTER" to begin your registration process. Each person attending will need to be registered.

Please use a DIFFERENT email address for each person registering.

  

Is there a dress code?

The Dress code is Business Casual.

 

Is there an age limit to enter the Expo?

Attendees must be 18 or older to attend Small Business Expo.

 

What are my parking options at the Event?

Parking is available. Please click HERE for parking information.

 

How can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Please contact clientservices@theshowproducers.com or call (212)404-2345.

 

What is the Lead Scanner App? 

Our Lead Scanner App is an excellent way to collect valuable contact information from each person you meet at Small Business Expo. The App is available on Android & iPhone. With this App you scan the QR code found on a person's badge at the Expo. Once you scan the QR Code, that person's contact information that was provided to us when they registered will appear on your phone to save (i.e., First Name, Last Name, Email Address, Phone #, Company Name, Job Title & Zip Code). You can then put notes and mark the lead as Cold, Warm or Hot for future follow up. The App also allows you to export all of your scans into an Excel Spreadsheet that you can then upload into your CRM, Email Marketing Software, Contact Database, etc. For more info about our Lead Scanner App, please click HERE.


How do I use the Lead Scanner App?

You will receive a separate email from us with details on how to download and use the Lead Scanner App on your smartphone (along with your License Code).  It is only available on iPhone & Android Devices. You may scan as many attendee & exhibitor badges as you’d like.  All contact information from that scan will be provided (name, company, phone #, email address, job title & zip code). If you have any questions or need your License Code, please visit us in the Registration Area at the Expo.

You can also CLICK HERE for additional details on how to use our App.

 

What is Beer & Biz Happy Hour?

Beer & Biz Happy Hour takes place on the Small Business Expo Exhibitor Floor from 3:30 pm-4:30 pm. Free Beer will be provided at the VIP Bar for Exhibitors and Attendees with a Gold, Platinum or Titanium Badge. We crank up the music, add Beer and everyone has a great time with some last minute networking! Please note you must be 21 years or older to consume alcohol. 

 

I want access to the Beer & Biz Happy Hour & the Lead Scanner App!

Great! Please purchase the Gold, Platinum or Titanium Badge.  These badges include both options (see the Badge Chart above for other items included with these badges). Please note you must be 21 years or older to consume alcohol and use the Open Bar.

 

What is the PRICE and what is the FEE listed on the Eventbrite options?

The "PRICE" is what Small Business Expo charges for that specific Badge Option. The "FEE" is the Eventbrite Registration processing fee. Eventbrite is a 3rd Party Registration company that we use to allow you to register for our events.

 

I already purchased a badge but would like to upgrade to a higher level. What do I do?

Please purchase the higher level option and then contact us by email or by phone at 212.404.2345 and we will refund your other badge.  You must purchase the higher level badge first before requesting a refund for the other badge.

 

Can I update my registration contact information?

Yes. Any updates to your contact information may be made when you arrive at the Expo in our Registration Area.  We are unable to make changes over the phone or online.

 

Will my Entrance Badge be emailed or mailed to me before the Expo?

No.  You will need to check-in with us at the Expo in our Registration Area.  We will print your badge on-site and provide you with a lanyard/clip and badge holder.  We do recommend that you print and bring your EventBrite Confirmation with QR Code for quick & expedited check-in.

 

Do I have to bring my printed EventBrite Confirmation to the event?

No, but we do recommend it.  We are able to look you up by your name and/or email address at the Expo.  However, bringing your EventBrite Confirmation with QR Code will speed up your check-in process.

 

VIP Reserved Seating - how does that work?

All of our workshop rooms & the Main Stage will have a row of seats reserved just for you.  Please be sure to always have your badge displayed for access to these reserved seats.  Your badge gives you access to these seats, no other ticket is needed. This option is only available for Platinum & Titanium Badge Holders.

 

What is Priority Seating in Speed Networking?

 Speed Networking is one of our most popular areas of the show. Like "Speed Dating" you get approximately 3 mins to exchange information and network with one person. When the bell goes off, you move to the next table and meet someone different. This is a quick way to meet about 20 new people in 45-60 minutes. Priority Seating is available for Titanium Badge Holders first, followed by everyone else. This area of the Expo tends to sell out so we highly recommend purchasing a Titanium Badge if you plan to participate in this part of the show. When you arrive at the Expo and get your Badge, your Badge will give you access to Priority Seating in this area. Please look for the Priority Seating line when you arrive at this area. Priority Seating badge holders will be seated first.

 

 

What is the company promo offer in the post-show "thank you" email included in my Titanium badge?

After the Expo, we will send out a special "THANK YOU" email to all of our registered attendees. As a Titanium Badge-Holder, we include your logo, contact Info, company description, link to your website and a special offer (optional). Please send this information to Andres@theshowproducers.com. Click Here to view a sample of this email.

 

 

The name on my registration doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?

Yes, you may update this information on-site in our Registration Area the day of the Expo.  We are unable to make changes to your registration over the phone or online.

 

Should I bring business cards to the event? Are flyers and other ads permitted?

Absolutely bring business cards, and lots of them! This is a huge networking event, we encourage networking and exchanging of business cards.  Flyers and other advertisements may not be given away unless you are an approved exhibitor.  However, you may display your business cards, flyers & other advertisements free of charge in our designated Business Card Exchange Area.

 

May I solicit my product/service to Expo Exhibitors and Sponsors?

No. We have a strict No Solicitation policy.  Please do not solicit your product/service to Exhibitors & Sponsors unless you are an Exhibitor/Sponsor with proper Exhibitor/Sponsor credentials listed on your badge. Violators will be asked to leave.  We thank you in advance for your cooperation.  If you would like to sell your product/service at the Expo, we encourage you to purchase an exhibitor space at the Expo.

 

I want to Exhibit and/or Sponsor Small Business Expo!

Great! Please contact us at (212)404-2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR INFO PAGE.

 

What is the Refund Policy?

Once a badge or Exhibitor Space is purchased, there are no refunds provided.

 

What is Small Business Expo's Terms & Conditions & Privacy Policy?

Please visit these links to review each. By registering for Small Business Expo you acknowledge that you have read and agree to both of these policies.

Terms & Conditions

Privacy Policy

description.text:
Experience Arizona’s Premier Unconference for Educators
EdCamp AZ: A fun, exciting, free networking opportunity for educators across the state!  Enjoy meeting other amazing educators, reflect on your school year and prepare for where you want to be next year!
Join EdCamp and Grand Canyon University for a collaborative day of learning at the FREE EdCamp AZ. Never mind keynote speakers, PowerPoint presentations and uninteresting subject matter. You decide the topics. You drive the conversation. You benefit from input from other educators. All at GCU!
The EdCamp model relies on roundtable discussion with like-minded educators that are passionate about expanding their knowledge. This is an unconference – collaboration is key and your input is valuable! To learn more about how EdCamps work, view this 2-minute video: https://youtu.be/gr7teMAk-hA
or watch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mp-3V6DAX_c&feature=youtu.be.
EdCamp AZ was a HUGE success last year attracting educators and edupreneurs from all over the state.  We even had a visit from Mayor Greg Stanton!  Watch EdCamp AZ highlights here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GfC7ypF9kC0
We'll see you on May 30th for an incredible way to wrap up your academic year and ignite your summer!

description.text:
PHOENIX:  Urban Fêtes is bringing the hottest - and - quietest party wave back to Phoenix! Join us February 23rd at Monarch Theatre for another epic Silent Party experience! Don a pair of headphones and rock with 3 DJs spinning the best Hip-Hop, R&B, Reggae and Top 40 hits! Get your tickets now, this event will sell out! http://www.silentpartyphx.eventbrite.com
Urban Fêtes' Silent Parties have taken the nation by storm and developed the reputation as a new wave of culture - where the audience is in total control of their musical and social environment. Silent parties have been around for decades, but Urban Fêtes has brought back the rave-like shindig with a modern twist. This is the ultimate go-to event for millennials to attend.
SPECIAL NOTES:- 21+ to party- Rain or Shine *We have a strict NO REFUND policy unless Urban Fetes cancels event.*- Tickets available at the door, but are limited
WHAT TO BRING:- Valid ID- Eventbrite ticket or code on your phone
HOW IT WORKS:When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of Urban Fetes wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ’s with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color (BLUE, RED, GREEN) LED that shows what channel you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off to talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave!
**By attending our parties you are subjected to photos and videos being used in our promotional efforts via our website, social media and print marketing.**
